Description: Nile silt pottery table amphora with a short foot, convex sides, a single nodular spout, two handles, a short neck widening to the off-set rim and decorated with cream and black-coloured painted bands on the shoulder, as well as traces of black around the rim of the spout. There is an incised line on the exterior of the rim 6mm below, and a firing stain on the front. Fabric is red and contains lots of straw, mica, tiny black stones and some some large pieces of calcium carbonate (Adams Fabric Type R32). The amphora was filled with straw. Adams Type J14 (1986, fig. 55).
